choices.text: She was conscious and pulse present
She was unconscious and pulse present
She was conscious and no pulse

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presented to the ER with dizziness. Her blood pressure is 80/60 mmHg, pulse rate is 45/minute. She was subsequently put in the below position. What was the reason for using this position?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) She was unconscious and pulse present The best position for an unconscious victim but pulse and breathing presents is recovery position

questions.text: A patient is undergoing preanesthetic evaluation. He is seated upright with the head neutral, mouth open, tongue protruded, and no phomation. The image of the mouth is given below. Which class does he belong to according to the modified Mallampati score?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Class I In the given image, the faucial pillars, uvula, and the soft palate are all visible. Therefore, this patient is classified as class I according to the modified Mallampati score. The modified Mallampati score is used to assess the difficulty of endotracheal intubation in a patient. The patient is seated upright with the neutral position of the head, open mouth, and protruded tongue and the patient is asked to not speak. The classification is done based on the visibility of structures through the mouth in this position

questions.text: A 25-year-old football player is brought to the emergency room after falling on the field during a match. His X-ray shows the findings-below. Which of the following peripheral blocks is indicated to restore the normal anatomy?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Interscalene block The given clinical vignette describes a case of shoulder dislocation as seen on the X-ray. Interscalene block provides surgical anaesthesia for procedures of the shoulder and upper arm. Interscalene nerve block is performed between the anterior and middle scalene muscles in the inter-scalene groove at the level of C6, where the brachial plexus emerges. It provides an adequate block of the superior and middle trunks of the brachial plexus. The ulnar nerve (C8, T1) from the inferior trunk may be missed. Hence, this block is not used for procedures of the forearm and hand.

choices.text: Has a port for orogastric tube

questions.text: What is the advantage of the following device?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Can facilitate endotracheal intubation The image shown above is the Fastrach laryngeal mask airway (LMA) or intubating LMA with an endotracheal tube within its lumen. It has a distinct advantage over other LMA designs as it can facilitate endotracheal intubation through the LMA device

questions.text: In the following condition as shown in the radiograph, which of the following procedures would be difficult to perform?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Tracheostomy Tracheostomy would be difficult to perform in this case of pneumothorax with tracheal deviation. The trachea is displaced from its usual midline position, making it challenging to accurately locate and access the trachea for the incision. The tracheostomy procedure requires precise placement to ensure proper airway management and avoid complications

questions.text: As an intern posted in the OT, you see the Anesthesia Senior Resident holding the needle shown in the image. What is the likely procedure that he is about to perform?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Epidural anesthesia The image shown is the 18 G Tuohy needle, which is used in epidural anesthesia.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man presented to the casualty with complaints of increasing shortness of breath, lightheadedness, and palpitations. He had an irregularly irregular pulse and blood pressure was 70\30 mm Hg. Soon the patient becomes unresponsive and with following ECG is obtained. What is the treatment of choice?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Immediate defibrillation The patient has suffered a cardiac arrest with a ventricular tachycardia as a rhythm. It’s a shockable rhythm and so needs immediate defibrillation.

questions.text: The type of laryngoscope blade shown in the given image is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Macintosh The given image shows Macintosh laryngoscopic blade. It is the most commonly used laryngoscopic blade for endotracheal intubation in adults. Laryngoscopic blades can be - Curved blade, Macintosh - Straight blade, Miller The Macintosh blade is preferred for adults, and the Miller blade for infants.

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient with COVID-19 infection develops shortness of breath and is brought to the hospital. His SpO2 increases from 81% to 83% on administering oxygen via facemask at 10 L/min. The decision to deliver oxygen using the device shown below is made. What is its oxygen delivery rate?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) 40-60 L/min The equipment shown in the image is high-flow nasal cannula (HFNC). It delivers oxygen at 40-60 L/min. This patient has persistent hypoxia after an adequate trial of standard oxygen therapy and should be started on high-flow nasal cannula oxygen therapy. High flow nasal cannula is a mode of respiratory support used in the management of acute respiratory failure. It delivers humidified gas via the nasal cannula at high flow rates.

questions.text: What is the type of circuit shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Closed circuit Closed circuit is a type of breathing circuit where the exhaled gases containing CO2 is passed through a CO2 absorber and recirculate the gasses back to the patient. It’s a complete rebreathing circuit.

questions.text: Identify the mask in the image used for patients with COVID-19 infection.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Non-rebreathing mask The mask in the image is a non-rebreathing mask (NRBM). It can be used for patients with COVID-19 infection. A NRBM has a reservoir bag attached to the mask in order to provide additional reservoir volume. In addition, there is a valve attached, which provides a unidirectional flow of gases. Flutter valves on the side ports prevent room air entrainment, while a valve incorporated between the mask and the reservoir bag prevents the entry of the exhaled gases.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect concerning the drug in the image below?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Contraindicated in egg allergic patients Propofol is not contraindicated in egg allergy patients. Propofol is formulated as an oil-in-water emulsion, which contains soybean oil, glycerol, and egg lecithin. Usually, egg allergies are a reaction to egg white (egg albumin). But, propofol contains egg lecithin, which is extracted from egg yolk, and so, propofol is not necessarily contraindicated in patients with a history of egg allergy.

questions.text: During your evening rounds in the ICU, you notice that the capnograph of a patient on controlled ventilation is as shown below. Which of the following is a likely cause that you would suspect ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Spontaneous respiratory effort The given capnograph shows clefts in the plateau phase of expiration known as curare clefts. This indicates spontaneous breathing efforts by the patient. The plateau phase of expiration in a capnograph represents the CO2 level in the air expired from the alveoli. During spontaneous breathing efforts, the patient might take inspiration which is not in sync with the controlled ventilation. This causes a decreased CO? level which is seen as a dip/cleft in the capnograph.

choices.text: Pressure relief valve which prevents leak of gases
Diameter index safety system that prevents wrong attachment of pipeline to machine
Pin index safety system that prevents wrong attachment of cylinder to machine
Pin index safety system that prevents wrong attachment of pipeline to machine

questions.text: Identify the safety feature in the image below and its correct use?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Pin index safety system that prevents wrong attachment of cylinder to machine Pin Index Safety System (PISS) is a safety measure to prevent incorrect cylinder attachment. It consists of a system of pins on anesthesia gas machine and their corresponding indexes on the neck of the cylinder.

questions.text: Identify the device shown below:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Mapleson type of circuit This is a typical image of a mapleson type of circuit which is a semi closed circuit. It is light in weight & easy to use and is cheap. It isn’t efficient as all the exhaled gases are vented in the atmosphere.

questions.text: A 47-year-old woman was brought to the casualty in an unconscious state after having suddenly collapsed. As there was no pulse, cardiopulmonary resuscitation was started and the monitor showed the following rhythm. What is the next step?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 1 mg epinephrine IV The patient has an organized, apparently normal ECG without a pulse – i.e the patient has pulseless electrical activity (PEA). A pulseless electrical activity involves a heterogeneous group of cardiac rhythms, all without a pulse. The immediate treatment for this is giving chest compressions and 1 mg epinephrine at the earliest until definitive therapy to the cause can be instituted.

questions.text: What procedure is the following device most suitable for?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Cleft palate surgery The device shown in the image is the south oral Ring-Adair-Elwyn (RAE) endotracheal tube. It is preferred for cleft palate and ophthalmic surgeries because it has a preformed right-angle bend at the level of the teeth so that it does not disrupt the surgical field

questions.text: What gas is the following cylinder used to carry?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Nitrous oxide Blue cylinders are used to store nitrous oxide. Maximum pressure in the nitrous oxide cylinder is around 745 psig. Critical temperature of nitrous oxide is 36.5°C, hence it is present in liquid form at room temperature.

questions.text: A mixture of gas X and oxygen is sometimes used in anesthetic practice to provide relief from upper airway edema until more definitive care can be delivered. Gas X is stored in the cylinder shown below. According to the Pin Index Safety System (PISS), what is the pin index of the given cylinder containing only gas X?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) No Pin The gas X used in the mixture is helium, stored in brown-colored cylinders as shown. Helium cylinder has no pin index. Helium-oxygen mixture, together known as heliox, is used to improve gaseous exchange in acute exacerbation of asthma and COPD. The helium-oxygen mixture in 79%-21% ratio is sometimes used in anesthetic practice to provide relief from upper airway obstructions due to subglottic edema, foreign bodies, and tracheal tumors. It is only a temporary measure that is used until definitive care is provided.

questions.text: What is the procedure being done in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Bier Block The position in the image of a hand with a tourniquet occluded limb shows a Bier Block. IVRA or Bier’s block involves the intravenous administration of a local anesthetic into a tourniquet-occluded limb. It is used to provide anesthesia for short surgical procedures (<90 minutes) on the limbs.
